question.questionText: Maria weighed a small, wet sponge. It weighed 38 grams. She left the sponge on the balance. The next day, Jose found the sponge on the balance. It weighed 22 grams. Both students weighed the sponge accurately. Why were the masses different?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: Some water evaporated from the sponge between the time Maria weighed the sponge and the time Jose weighed the sponge.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: Their masses were different because the water on the sponge evaporated. If you leave water out for a certain period of time, it will evaporate.
The mass was different because water evaporated from the sponge before they weighed it again so the weight changed.
Well because the water probably evaporated 16 grams the day Maria weighed the sponge. When Jose weighed it, it was probably lighter.
They were different because if you leave water out it will evaporate. Some of the water in the sponge evaporated.
Because water is really strong and it could make a sponge heavier but when it dried, water was not on the sponge no more so that made it weigh lower.
They were different because all of the water in the sponge evaporated and water is heavy so it made the sponge heavy but when it evaporated it made the sponge weigh lighter.
Overnight the water in the sponge had evaporated so that sponge weighed less.
Because over the hours the sponge evaporated.
The masses were different because Maria probably left the balance by a heated source. If she had left it by a heated source, the wet sponge the water in it might have evaporated.
Because when Maria weighed it, it had water in it and when Jose weighed it, the water had already evaporated.
Because some of the water from the sponge evaporated.
The water in the sponge evaporated.
The sponge has water in it. The water evaporated and made the sponge not as heavy.
That happened because when you leave something out it will get evaporated.
Because it evaporated.

The masses were different because within the next day some of the water evaporated out of the sponge, so now that it has lost some of its water, it weighs less.
The masses were different because some of the water on the damp sponge evaporated.
The mass was different because some water evaporated from the sponge and made it weigh less.
Because maybe Maria put in more water than Jose.
The masses were different because some water evaporated overnight.
Because the sponge was evaporating to the air.

Because they both evaporated and lost weight.
Because of evaporation from the sun.
Because the sponge evaporated.
Evaporation.
The wind and the water.
Because overnight, the water got warmer somehow.
That must have been from evaporation. The water on the sponge probably evaporated.

Because the sponge was left there all night, so most of the water from the sponge evaporated. Maria weighed the sponge when it was still very wet, but Jose weighed it when the water had already evaporated.
Because the sponge evaporated.
Maria let the sponge sit and water from the sponge evaporated and took water out of the sponge and turned it into water vapor so the sponge got lighter since it had less mass.
Because the sponge dried when Maria left.
The water on the sponge was evaporated, so Jose's sponge was lighter than Maria's.
Because the water inside the sponge had partly evaporated.
